metadata.Title: CVE-2020-10742 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: A flaw was found in the Linux kernel. An index buffer overflow during Direct IO write leading to the NFS client to crash. In some cases, a reach out of the index after one memory allocation by kmalloc will cause a kernel panic. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and system availability.

notes.Note: sbeattie> reproducer in Red Hat bug 1824270.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
